history.content:
Hi there, 

There is no such requirement. Please view this page to familiarize yourself with your degree requirements: http://engineering.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/docs/eecs-worksheet-2011-2014.pdf

The 20 Upper Division EECS units must be taken from EE, CS, or EECS courses.


The 45 Technical Engineering Units include the CS 61 and EE 16 series, as well as the 20 UD EECS units. The rest must be taken from an engineering department. This includes CS. Info courses are offered by the School of Information, not the College of Engineering.

children.subject: Is there any way to petition for INFO 159 to be considered for the 45 technical engineering units, or is it a hard and fast rule?

history.content:
Do Upper divs from other technical departments count towards Engineering upper div units? Specifically the 40 units that EECS majors need to graduate.

Can CS-like classes from the INFO dept count as upper div EECS units? Classes such as INFO 159 (Natural Language Processing).
history.subject: Other department upper divs count as EECS/Engineering upper div units
